Pre-Game Insights: Manager Rob Thomson gave Craig Kimbrel a vote of confidence after he allowed the walk-off run in Game 3, saying 'I trust these guys' and that Kimbrel had'scattered the zone at times' but 'bounced back'
Post-Match Reflections: The Phillies' inability to produce when it mattered most, specifically their expensive and experienced lineup going cold, was the primary reason for their NLCS loss
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies' roster construction, particularly carrying Taijuan Walker and Michael Lorenzen without a clear role, was questioned as it limited their flexibility in the playoffs
Regression hit the team hard, with players like Aaron Nola, Ranger Suarez, and Nick Castellanos experiencing a decline in performance
The Phillies thrust 23-year-old Johan Rojas and 22-year-old Orion Kerkering into important roles almost immediately, but they struggled in the playoffs
Others: The Phillies' reliance on Kimbrel, who had a nearly identical ERA to 1993 Mitch Williams, was criticized as he allowed the walk-off run in Game 3 and blew a two-run lead in Game 4
Manager Rob Thomson's decision to go right back to Kimbrel in Game 4 after an erratic outing in Game 3 was questioned
The Phillies' inability to produce with runners in scoring position, going 2-for-17 in Games 6 and 7, was a significant factor in their loss
